description.p: Barbarians who practice the Path of the Belly Brewer channel their inner hunger and magical concoctions to unleash unique effects during battle. They are skilled in crafting and consuming magical potions that enhance their combat prowess.

Starting at 3rd level, you gain access to Belly Concoctions, which allow you to mix and brew magical effects during your rage. You can choose from Combat, Utility, or Whimsy, each with its own unique benefits:

ul.li: Combat: While raging, you can use your reaction to deflect ranged attacks, reducing the damage by 1d12 + your Constitution modifier + your Barbarian level. Additionally, you can stretch your melee reach by 5 feet on your turn, adding an extra 1d6 damage to melee weapon attacks.

Utility: During your rage, you can consume an object as an action to heal yourself for 1d8 + your Constitution modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier per long rest.
Whimsy: While raging, gain the effects of the Prestidigitation and Thaumaturgy cantrips. Additionally, random magical effects occur each turn as determined by the GM.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain the Quick Brew feature. You can activate the effects of a common potion without consuming it. The effect lasts until your next long rest. The DC for any potion effects requiring a saving throw equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. You may swap your chosen potion after each long rest.

At 14th level, you gain the Mighty Quick Brew feature. You learn an additional potion to use with your Quick Brew feature. Additionally, you can now activate the effects of uncommon potions without consuming them. You may swap your chosen potions when you gain a level in this class.
